meanings.definition: A person or thing that preserves something.
meanings.sent1: My grandma is a wonderful preservers of family traditions.
meanings.sent2: The preservers in the museum ensure the artifacts remain in good condition.
meanings.sent3: The preservers of ancient recipes always keep the secret ingredients safe.
meanings.sent4: She was like a preservers of memories, holding onto every precious moment.
meanings.sent5: The preservers of history carefully protect the valuable documents.

meanings.definition: A device or substance used to prevent decay or spoilage.
meanings.sent1: The preservers in the food containers keep the fruits fresh.
meanings.sent2: Vacuum sealing bags are great preservers for storing food.
meanings.sent3: The preservers in the fridge work hard to keep the milk from going bad.
meanings.sent4: The preservers in the form of antioxidants help extend the shelf life of products.
meanings.sent5: Using preservers like salt and sugar can help preserve homemade jams.

meanings.definition: A group of people who work to protect or maintain something.
meanings.sent1: The preservers of the park plant trees and clean up litter.
meanings.sent2: Environmental preservers strive to keep the oceans clean.
meanings.sent3: The preservers of the forest organize regular clean-up events.
meanings.sent4: The preservers of wildlife rescue and rehabilitate injured animals.
meanings.sent5: Historical preservers work to restore old buildings and landmarks.
